3. Update CLAUDE.md:

Acceptance criteria: CLAUDE.md reflects Technician MOM=64, current test count (889), rare/epic tier findings, variant impact notes.

title: New player experience ‚Äî first-match clarity audit ‚Äî COMPLETE
description:
‚úÖ COMPLETED Round 2: Comprehensive walkthrough of first-time player experience identified 6 clarity gaps and 4 prioritized improvements. Full analysis written to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-3.md.

Clarity gaps: stat abbreviations (MOM/CTL/GRD/INIT/STA), gear overwhelm, speed/power tradeoff, counter system learn-by-losing, pass results unexplained, melee transition jarring.

Proposals ranked by impact:
- P1: Stat Tooltips (‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê) ‚Äî unblocks 80% of confusion
- P2: Impact Breakdown (‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê) ‚Äî closes learning loop
- P3: Loadout Presets (implemented in BL-058)
- P4: Counter Chart (‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê)

title: ARIA attributes and semantic markup for accessibility ‚Äî COMPLETE
description: ‚úÖ COMPLETED Round 1: Extended accessibility to SpeedSelect.tsx and AttackSelect.tsx (attack cards + melee wins dots). All interactive elements now keyboard-navigable with proper aria-labels. 830+ tests (no breakage).

title: Rare/epic tier balance sweep (fill tier gap) ‚Äî COMPLETE
description: ‚úÖ COMPLETED Round 2: Rare and epic tier win rates documented with full analysis. Epic tier is MOST compressed (5.7pp spread, 0 flags). Charger epic peak confirmed (51%). Technician rare spike (55.1%) resolves by epic (49.2%). Bulwark dominance fade validated. All findings in orchestrator/analysis/balance-tuner-round-2.md. Verdict: No balance changes needed.

title: Gear variant affinity hints + quick build presets ‚Äî COMPLETE

All 830 tests passing. LoadoutScreen.tsx and App.css updated.

title: Melee carryover + softCap interaction tests ‚Äî COMPLETE

Tests 830‚Üí845 (+15). All passing. Zero bugs found. Stat pipeline confirmed (carryover ‚Üí softCap ‚Üí fatigue). Analysis in orchestrator/analysis/qa-round-2.md.

title: Implement impact breakdown UI for pass results (learning loop critical)
description:
Follow-up to BL-063 design specs. Implement expandable impact breakdown card on pass result screen.

**BLOCKER: BL-063x (engine-dev PassResult extensions) must complete FIRST**
- BL-063x adds 9 optional fields to PassResult interface
- BL-064 depends on these fields to populate breakdown data
- Estimated: BL-063x 2-3h (Round 6 Phase A) ‚Üí BL-064 6-8h (Round 6 Phase B)

**Readiness**: UI infrastructure 40% complete (PassResult.tsx exists with partial breakdown). CSS foundation 100% complete (150+ lines added by polish agent).

**Acceptance criteria**:
1. Expandable card showing impact breakdown (collapsed by default on mobile)
2. Displays: Your Impact, Opponent Impact, Margin, Attack Advantage, Guard Contribution, Fatigue Effect
3. Bar graph comparing your impact vs opponent impact (visual comparison)
4. Icons + clear labels for each stat
5. Responsive layout (fits within viewport on 320px mobile)
6. Keyboard accessible (Tab through components, arrow keys expand/collapse)
7. Screen reader friendly (aria-expanded, descriptive labels)
8. 889+ tests passing (no regressions)

**Implementation phases**:
1. Component scaffolding (2h) ‚Äî 6 subcomponents + wrapper
2. Bar graph visualization (1h) ‚Äî SVG or CSS-based
3. Expandable animation (1h) ‚Äî 0.3s smooth height transition
4. Conditional rendering (1h) ‚Äî show/hide based on data availability
5. Accessibility & responsive (2h) ‚Äî keyboard nav, screen reader, mobile
6. Integration & testing (1-2h) ‚Äî App.tsx integration, 889+ tests pass

**Files to modify**:
- src/App.tsx (integrate PassResultBreakdown component in MatchScreen)
- src/App.css (already has 150+ lines prepared by polish agent)
- May create new PassResultBreakdown.tsx component

Estimate: 6-8 hours (after BL-063x complete). Medium risk due to PassResult dependency.

Depends on: BL-063 (design ‚úÖ complete), BL-063x (engine PassResult extensions ‚è≥ pending)

title: Rare/epic tier melee exhaustion tests (validation) ‚Äî COMPLETE
description:
‚úÖ COMPLETED Round 3: Added 8 comprehensive tests covering rare/epic tier stability:

**Tests Added**:
1. Rare tier multi-round stability (2 tests): Charger/Technician 3-round, Tactician/Breaker with penetration
2. Epic tier carryover + softCap (3 tests): Unseated charger with penalties, softCap boundary crossing, stamina drain validation
3. Mixed tier + variant stress (3 tests): Rare vs epic with variants, epic mirror match, carryover stacking validation

**Results**: Tests 845‚Üí853 (+8 tests, exceeds requirement). All passing. Zero bugs found. Rare/epic tier stability validated across carryover, softCap, variants, and multi-round combat.

Analysis written to orchestrator/analysis/qa-round-3.md.

title: Variant-specific win rate analysis (gear impact quantification) ‚Äî COMPLETE
description:
‚úÖ COMPLETED Round 3: Comprehensive variant analysis across 6 configurations (43,200 total matches, N=200 per matchup):

**Simulations**: Bare (aggressive/defensive), Uncommon (aggressive/balanced/defensive, full 6√ó6√ó3), Giga (aggressive/balanced/defensive, full 6√ó6√ó3)

**5 Critical Findings**:
1. Aggressive gear AMPLIFIES imbalance (Bulwark +6.2pp at giga, Charger +0.3pp ‚Äî softCap compression kills MOM scaling)
2. Defensive gear COMPRESSES balance ‚Äî 6.6pp spread at giga (BEST BALANCE EVER, zero flags)
3. Variant effect size > Rarity effect size (¬±2.6pp swing = 3+ rarity tiers of impact)
4. Balanced variant = Legacy baseline (MEMORY.md needs correction)
5. Matchup-level variant impact 10-15pp swings
6. Aggressive gear creates "snowball" melee-favored dynamics (+15.8pp melee rate)

**Verdict**: Variant system WORKING AS DESIGNED. No code changes needed. UI tooltips needed to explain aggressive‚â†better.

Analysis written to orchestrator/analysis/balance-tuner-round-3.md (485 lines).

title: CRITICAL: Extend PassResult for Impact Breakdown (BL-064 blocker) ‚Äî ROUND 7
description:
üî¥ **CRITICAL BLOCKER**: BL-064 (ui-dev impact breakdown, 6-8h work) is blocked waiting on PassResult schema extension.

**Scope**: Add 9 optional fields to PassResult interface to support impact breakdown UI.

**Fields needed** (from design-round-4-bl063.md Section 5):
1. counterWon: boolean (did player win counter?)
2. counterBonus: number (+4 or -4 impact from counter win/loss)
3. guardStrength: number (your guard stat before reduction)
4. guardReduction: number (how much guard absorbed damage)
5. fatiguePercent: number (current stamina % at end of pass)
6. momPenalty: number (MOM reduced by fatigue)
7. ctlPenalty: number (CTL reduced by fatigue)
8. maxStaminaTracker: number (for fatigue calculation context)
9. breakerPenetrationUsed: boolean (if opponent is Breaker)

**Files to modify**:
- src/engine/types.ts (PassResult interface ‚Äî add optional fields with TSDoc comments)
- src/engine/calculator.ts (resolveJoustPass ‚Äî populate fields with actual values)
- src/engine/phase-joust.ts (ensure fields exported correctly)

**Test requirements**:
- All existing tests still pass (897+)
- New field values match impact breakdown design templates
- Fields optional (backwards compatible with existing code)
- No test assertions need updates (all fields optional)

**Acceptance criteria**:
1. PassResult fields added to types.ts with TSDoc comments
2. calculator.ts resolveJoustPass populates all 9 fields
3. All 897+ tests passing with zero regressions
4. BL-064 unblocked (ui-dev can implement immediately)

**Estimate**: 2-3 hours
**Blocks**: BL-064 (6-8h ui-dev impact breakdown, critical learning loop)
**Depends on**: BL-063 design spec (complete)

**Detailed specs**: orchestrator/analysis/design-round-4-bl063.md (Section 5, lines 410-448)

Write to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-4.md.

title: NEW: Design variant tooltips (aggressive/balanced/defensive strategy explanations)
description:
Follow-up to BL-066 (balance-tuner variant analysis). BL-066 discovered variant system creates MASSIVE balance swings (¬±7pp for Bulwark, ¬±3pp for Charger) but players don't understand aggressive‚â†better.

**Problem**: Players assume "Aggressive = Better" and miss strategic depth. Without tooltips, players may optimize for wrong variant (e.g., aggressive Charger at giga is WORSE than defensive +2.9pp).

**Solution**: Add variant tooltips on gear selection screen explaining strategic impact:
- **Aggressive**: "Higher offense, lower defense. Favors quick unseats and melee. Riskier stamina. ¬±6pp swing at giga."
- **Balanced**: "Equal offense and defense. Reliable for all playstyles. Legacy baseline."
- **Defensive**: "Higher defense, lower offense. Favors long jousts and stamina endurance. Safer against unseats. ¬±1-3pp swing at giga."

**Key insights for tooltips**:
- Variant choice = 3+ rarity tiers of impact (NOT cosmetic)
- Aggressive creates "snowball" melee-favored dynamics (+15.8pp more melee matches)
- Defensive produces BEST GIGA BALANCE EVER (6.6pp spread, zero flags)
- Charger better with defensive (+2.9pp), NOT aggressive (+0.3pp)

**Acceptance criteria**: Variant strategy tooltips (text for all 3 variants), placement on LoadoutScreen, mockup showing tooltip positioning, acceptance criteria for ui-dev implementation.

Write to orchestrator/analysis/design-round-4.md.
